content: about this simple blanket was created out of necessity i needed another way to use up all my yarn scraps and advent mini skeins that had slowly been encompassing a giant basket in my loft i wanted to crochet a blanket that would use up lots of yarn but one that wouldn t require any thought or counting or figuring out if i m inserting my hook into the right stitch at the beginning or end of a row out of necessity was this scrappy-style blanket pattern born and it meets all my needs i m so happy to share the pattern with you size my sample blanket made with fingering weight yarn scraps measures 38 96 5 cm x 60 152 cm yarn 500 g of any fingering or sock-weight yarn scraps and leftover mini skeins will work great for this project if you decide to use a heavier-weight yarn you will end up with a larger blanket notions *progress keeper or clip-on style st marker to indicate rs of work *scissors hook i/9 5 5 mm crochet hook gauge 15 double_crochet + 8 row of double_crochet = 4 10 cm on size i/9 5 5 mm crochet hook or size hook you need to obtain gauge in double_crochet blocked
